description: Elm functional language patterns for web apps

skills.name: Install Elm
skills.pattern: npm install -g elm

skills.name: elm init
skills.pattern: elm init

skills.name: elm make
skills.pattern: elm make src/Main.elm --output=main.js

skills.name: elm reactor
skills.pattern: elm reactor

skills.name: Module
skills.pattern: module Main exposing (main)

skills.name: Import
skills.pattern: import Html exposing (Html, div, text)

skills.name: TEA
skills.pattern: Model (state) + Update (reducer) + View (render) = The Elm Architecture

skills.name: Browser.sandbox
skills.pattern: main = Browser.sandbox { init = init, update = update, view = view }

skills.name: Browser.element
skills.pattern: main = Browser.element { init = init, update = update, view = view, subscriptions = subscriptions }

skills.name: Type Alias
skills.pattern: type alias Model = { count : Int, name : String }

skills.name: Init
skills.pattern:
init : Model
init = { count = 0, name = "" }

skills.name: Msg Type
skills.pattern: type Msg = Increment | Decrement | SetName String

skills.name: Update Function
View Function
skills.pattern:
view : Model -> Html Msg
view model = div [] [ text (String.fromInt model.count) ]

skills.name: Html Elements
skills.pattern: div [ class "container" ] [ h1 [] [ text "Title" ], p [] [ text "Content" ] ]

skills.name: onClick
skills.pattern: button [ onClick Increment ] [ text "Add" ]

skills.name: onInput
skills.pattern: input [ onInput SetName, value model.name ] []

skills.name: Cmd
skills.pattern:
update msg model = case msg of
  FetchData -> (model, Http.get { url = "/api", expect = ... })

skills.name: Http.get
skills.pattern: Http.get { url = "/api/data", expect = Http.expectJson GotData decoder }

skills.name: Sub
skills.pattern:
subscriptions : Model -> Sub Msg
subscriptions model = Time.every 1000 Tick

skills.name: Decoder
skills.pattern:
import Json.Decode as D
userDecoder = D.map2 User (D.field "name" D.string) (D.field "age" D.int)

skills.name: Encoder
skills.pattern:
import Json.Encode as E
encodeUser user = E.object [ ("name", E.string user.name) ]

skills.name: Maybe Type
skills.pattern:
type Maybe a = Just a | Nothing
Maybe.withDefault 0 maybeInt

skills.name: Result Type
skills.pattern: type Result error value = Ok value | Err error

skills.name: List Operations
skills.pattern:
List.map (\x -> x * 2) [1, 2, 3]
List.filter (\x -> x > 0) list

skills.name: Pipe Operator
skills.pattern: list |> List.map fn |> List.filter pred |> List.length

skills.name: Record Update
skills.pattern: { model | count = model.count + 1, name = "New" }

skills.name: Ports
skills.pattern:
port sendMessage : String -> Cmd msg
port messageReceiver : (String -> msg) -> Sub msg

skills.name: elm install
skills.pattern:
elm install elm/http
elm install elm/json

skills.name: No Runtime Errors
skills.pattern: Elm's compiler catches all errors at compile time - no runtime exceptions in production
